top_categories.workout_context: Pisgah Monster Cross’s pisgah national forest gravel (60%), singletrack/dirt (40%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Pisgah Monster Cross isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Pisgah Monster Cross when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Pisgah Monster Cross rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Pisgah Monster Cross — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Pisgah Monster Cross’s pisgah national forest—technical appalachian terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Pisgah Monster Cross’s 8,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Pisgah Monster Cross. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Pisgah Monster Cross — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on pisgah national forest—technical appalachian terrain.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Pisgah Monster Cross count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Pisgah Monster Cross’s pisgah national forest—technical appalachian terrain drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Pisgah Monster Cross’s 8,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Pisgah Monster Cross’s 50 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Pisgah Monster Cross. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Pisgah Monster Cross demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride pisgah national forest—technical appalachian terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: pisgah national forest gravel (60%), singletrack/dirt (40%), technical appalachian terrain. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 50 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Over Under to prepare you for 50 miles of pisgah national forest—technical appalachian terrain in Brevard, North Carolina (Pisgah National Forest).
